required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase II Study of OsrHSA in Patients With Decompensated Cirrhotic Ascites
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Multicenter, Randomized, Positive-Controlled, and Multi-Cohort Study of OsrHSA in Patients With Decompensated Cirrhotic Ascites

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to study the efficacy of IV OsrHSA or positive control HSA (10 g and 20 g IV everyday) for 14 days. After a screening period of up to 14 days, the eligible subjects will be randomized in a 4:1 ratio to OsrHSA and positive control HSA, respectively, in each cohort. Each enrolled subject will receive multiple assigned doses of OsrHSA. The Investigator and subjects will be blind to treatment assignment (OsrHSA or positive control HSA) in each cohort. During the study, subjects will be evaluated for efficacy, safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity. In each cohort, subjects will be stratified by baseline serum albumin level. If serum albumin reaches 35 g/L or more, the study drug or control drug administration may be terminated early. Subjects will have 3 follow-up visits in 2 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: OrsHSA exhibits good efficacy by rescue serum albumin levels.
primary_outcome.description: A relatively high percentage of subjects whose serum albumin reaches 35 g/L or more at any time up to 14 days by using OsrHSA.

intervention.description: OsrHSA a recombinant HSA, which was expressed and purified from the plant Oryza sativa
